website_summaries.verdict: More expensive, but a powerful product.
pros: For removing scratches and swirls while cleaning the clear coat, this product works well for most paints
Though this product should be used carefully, it can reliably remove most light scratches or fading
cons: This product may leave a residue that can be difficult to remove

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: With the proper prep and technique this is a wonderful product. If you're nervous about hurting your paint, study up and go slow. Paint correction takes patience and preparation. I've had nothing but wonderful results, albeit with a beer break or two. Photo shows one pass with this product with a cheap polisher, below the stripe is the before. This was on a 16 year old civic.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Swirl marks on a black car
customer_reviews.text: I have used all 4 of the v series compounds on a new black bc/cc paint job. I was having problems with swirls after using the V38 compound. So I ordered some of the VSS hoping to solve the swirl issue. I believe the swirls were worse. I tried every pad, different pressures, different amounts of polish and different durations. So I purchased some 3M ultrafine ex #3 polish, and the 8" pad. After about 15 minutes working on a panel the swirl marks are gone. The 3M number I used is 06068. So if you are having issues with this product line and swirls, try the 3M/ product. You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BILL RICHARDSON

customer_reviews.title: Nervous
customer_reviews.text: So at some point I must have scrap my garage.. it let a ugly scratch on my 2016 pilot. When we applied this product I was a bit nervous .. it goes on thick. But my husband watched the chemical guys video on how to apply it.. follow the video step- by -step! The product is think and gritty. I was impressed it got the whole scratch out..
customer_reviews.author: Haley Jauregui

customer_reviews.title: First scratch remover I've ever had to work.
customer_reviews.text: Applied V-34 and then a layer of this. It removed most of the scratches.
customer_reviews.author: zq8 blazer

customer_reviews.title: Avarage resulths makes a lot of mess
customer_reviews.text: So, normally I love Chemical Guys and their product (butter wax is amazing) but this one is disappointing. Its very hard to to take it off and it leaves marks all over... I even used their microfiber c. but still its messy and results are just avarage... (I dont like when I can see the cricles on the sun from movments).
customer_reviews.author: Mirza Smajic

customer_reviews.title: This product sanded my clear coat and created much worse much more apparent swirls.
customer_reviews.text: If I could leave less stars I would. I purchased this product because I trusted “my chemical guys” and was looking to get rid of my “towel swirls” on my Tesla Model S. And after applying this product the granular never “broke down” with a foam applicator, when I finished the hood and wiped away, the swirls WERE 1000X times worse. DO NOT BUY. I now have to figure out how to get rid of the damage this has caused to my clear coat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overrated crap does nothing
customer_reviews.text: Seriously what a rip did this crap 3 times on my trunck lid to remove light scratches and swirls from previous owner. Did nothing seriously nothing made it shine but that's not why I bought this. I used a full electric setup with orange chemical crap pad and got 0 results super pissed waisted an hour of my life and $150 on this setup for nothing. Overrated
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Don't fall for the hype, it's just like any other and not worth the insane price.
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. The only "Scratch and Swirl Remover" you are purchasing for this ridiculous price are the words on the label, the stuff itself behaves just like every other compound out there I've used. Preventing and/or removing swirls is all about technique, and this stuff is not going to help you better than many cheaper options out there. I tested this stuff along with the cheaper stuff I have and it's exactly the same aside from the marketing and labeling of it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Not an eraser on black.
customer_reviews.text: Expected more. Spent HOURS with a DA applicator and pad and didn’t quite get the results I expected. I did get the VERY light scratches and all swirls to disappear, with use of the full process, but the more aggressive, but not fingernail deep scratches, were only leasended. I recommend the DA use of applying and let it sit for an additional 10 minutes past the directions. DONT let it dry and use the conditioner!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Halo
customer_reviews.text: I dunno if it was my technique, or the product but it's just didnt work well. I followed all the CM guys guides right down to useing identical products and pads. It's just left lots of haloing on the car. I know its suppose to break down to a polish, but it just never seemed to get to that point. I also experimented with other methods on a diffrent car. Same results. It's hard to rate a product if it COULD be you that's the problem...I give two stars only. Because the product was made to look easier the it seems, a d if it's my method...well it was the method they suggested. Other wise I love CM products
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your paint toughness
customer_reviews.text: This is a light compound and won't cover everything. I recommend using Chemical Guys other V Series compound and testing what works best with your car. Being a auto detailer, every paint job is different and in my opinion this won't cover all cars.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Failed me big time.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I washed it, clay blocked it, was so excited to try this on my 04 saab Aero who needs a face lift, aaaannndddd....fail, sure it’s glossy and slippery but not a single light scratch was removed, not a scratch at all was gone. Man, after the clay block was a full on success I was all about chemical guys, but this kinda of sucks. I bought waterless wash, interior cleaner and microfiber wash and was going to get leather products next...but now I don’t know. If they fail I’ll be looking for something new. But the clay block and lube, awesome.
customer_reviews.author: SmurfHunterX

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!! Dont buy!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely upset at the damage this product did to my vehicle. Followed exactly as directed by instructions of chemical guys published. Made swirls WORSE! Fender does not match the rest of vehicle now (black 2020 acadia). BUYER BEWARE!! The other products of chemical guys for interior are fine but this is trash product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scratch and Swirling my head
customer_reviews.text: Pros: $10. Cons: Does not spread evenly. It’s like a creamer toothpaste. 5 times 5 rounds 5 attempts in 2 1/2 days. Each time was given more sitting penetrating action to do its job. And nothing. No swirl no scratch removed. Nada. Unfortunate. To top it off it’s a mess and struggle to remove film resin. Ugh. Made my car from bad to worse.
customer_reviews.author: sergio

customer_reviews.title: At least it smells good
customer_reviews.text: Goes on and off easy enough. Used with maguires microfiber cutting disc and a rupes da action polisher. Applied at low speed then polish in on high speed. It did make a slight improvement but not as much as expected. Maybe additional applications but I expected not to see light swirl Marks after use. Going to try a different product for comparison but I've been detailing cars for over 10 years. I typically cut with a maguires light/med cutting compound and it leaves the paint looking near perfect.
customer_reviews.author: jason Lever

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: Used this with an orange hex pad and a power polisher. Works okay but I had to do three passes on my truck to get it remotely shiny. Also used Maguires compound and polish. Maybe my truck was just super neglected and the paint was awful but this product didn't fully remove any swirls or paint scuffs like I've seen from other reviews. Will continue to use regularly but just know this isn't a miracle product like most reviews led me to believe. Take your time, and be patient. Multiple passes and steady hand will give you decent results. Compared to how the paint was before this is a pretty great improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Fears

customer_reviews.title: They make great products
customer_reviews.text: I recently used this on an old mower hood that had been abused for a few years. I used a dual action polisher and a polishing pad. Easy application and great results. Topped it off with some chemical guys butter wax and its looking like new again. I cant wait to use this on the autos too!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Saw minimal results
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t see the results I was expecting. Watched several utube videos from the chemical guys and did exactly as they started to do washed And clayed prior to using. Applied with machine and even by hand with there orange pads. Spent 7 hrs working on the car and while it looks better then it did it’s cause of the wax. Still see swirls and scratches. Dissatisfied with this. I even saw a utube video where they applied vss by hand , do I even did a very small spot that had swirl marks. Still seen them. This stuff is no better miguiers. Totally crap
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I initially tried this product with a buffer and it made it worst, then I tried it by hand and it ...
customer_reviews.text: It works. I initially tried this product with a buffer and it made it worst, then I tried it by hand and it remove the swirls I created and the old ones. It's hard to tellin the photo, but the swirls are on the left and the product is on the right.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Hand polish results HERE!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!! Is all I gotta say. Wow!!!! This product is worth every single penny. Crazy thing is I applied it with their hex logic orange pad by hand. So. It’s not a easy process it’s a task. Took me over 4 hours to do it properly with no garage. I do have a a car port but it’s open on all sides. With that being said it was a bit of a task to do it but you see results IMMEDIATELY!!!!!!!! Like within the first few mins.. thank you chemical guys. Y’all got this down to a science man.
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Magic in a bottle!!!
customer_reviews.text: I simply can not speak highly enough about this product... it is magic in a bottle, my only regret was not taking before/after pictures to show you what an amazing job it does. I cleaned the scratched area well, use a lubricated clay bar to remove surface impurities, put a few drops of VSS on the orange rotory pad and within 60 - 90 seconds all of my surface scratch/swirl mark woes were no more. Watch the youtube howto video for this product and you cannot go wrong!!! Thanks Chemical Guys!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn E

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with first application
customer_reviews.text: Attempted to apply by hand and initially thought my scratch issues were solved. After a couple hours, I realized that the scratches were still visible in different lighting. I'll give it another shot and see if it helps.
customer_reviews.author: RYAN C

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on minor swirls as promised - not sure if you want to use if have minor scratches
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how people had success with this product. I have a grey non-metallic paint job so it shows all imperfections. Had minor swirls due to a contaminated rag from a previous clean. Couldn't feel the scratches so not that deep. Purchased the product, watched all tutorial videos and first applied by hand with a brand new polishing pad, no success. Then tried using my rotary polisher, new polishing pad, also didn't work. Doubt this is user error or maybe its too course of a cutting solution. I would return if I could. Buyer beware and make sure you know what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Dante

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: So I used this with a an orange polishing pad that comes with the avidity da polisher, and while if did add some color and shine, I still had swirl marks. This was my first time polishing a car sobit could be user error, but I will be trying something else next time. On a positive note it did polish my glass well with da polisher and a glass polishing pad.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Only OK.... Nothing Great
customer_reviews.text: This is Good for new at home detailers to learn detailing. Overpriced IMHO, but I feel this is safe to use with little chance of damaging Toyota soft paint. Safety is what I was looking for, but now that I've learned and gained confidence, experience in correcting paint, I wouldn't buy this again. There are better products available.
customer_reviews.author: FJester

customer_reviews.title: LIKE NEW
customer_reviews.text: A little backstory is i got a 2012 Mustang with a poor detailing job done. The entire car had swirl marks all over it and it really made it look terrible. I decided to give this a try and boy it was 100% worth it! It took away almost all of the swirl marks that were on my car. It totally changes the look of your car and will make it shine like new again. The only reason it’s not 5 stars is because there’s a few still on there. I machine buffed the entire car for about 3.5 hours and it was well worth it. Don’t know if it works this well doing it by hand. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Mateo Blecha

customer_reviews.title: Expectations Exceeded!
customer_reviews.text: I did not have high expectations because my truck is 20 years old and has never had any paint work done. Other than religiously washing it over the years, I can count on one hand how many times it has been hand waxed. The truck looks spectacular! Sure, if you get close you can see all the rock chips and scratches that weren't fixed, but from a distance it shines like a Q-ball!
customer_reviews.author: ADAM CRAIG

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I used a standard orbital buffer with a microfiber cover. See the before and after pictures - before is water spots that we could not get off, and swirls. The after is like GLASS. Worth the money! I think this one bottle would do the whole car 10 times at least. Also make sure you watch the Chemical guys video on how to do this properly on youtube..
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burns

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The before and after shots of my Infinity, the the results on my Porsche. This is an incredible product, I can’t say enough about how pleased I am about the results. Absolutely incredible showroom shine and proof the scratches are gone. After seeing the Chemical Guys video, thought I’d give it a shot. The photos speak for themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H.

customer_reviews.title: Preforms remarkably
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an amazing product. I stupidly put my jacket on the hood of my car and laid a box on top of it. When I lifted the box off I saw a zipper imprent about a foot long on my hood from the jacket's zipper. I was so mad at myself and tried cleaning and waxxing the car with a clay bar. It helped a tiny bit, but not really. I bought this product with low expectations but after about 5 minutss of applying, spreading, and wiping away the zipper marks started the vanish. The whole thing took about an hour and there are super light marks still there but nothing compared to before. I'm very pleased with the results!
customer_reviews.author: the trap daddy

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: I try and use a lot of car products. Be careful with this product. Not sure if I mis-used it or not but it created a much worse situation of swirls and haze than when I started. I don't think I applied too hard (by hand). I had to use a different product to fix the problem I created with this one. I will not purchase this again. In fact, I would be afraid to use it and will throw it out. I hate to give an unfavorable review of anything but this experience was a slight nightmare for me. Just not sure what I cold have done wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McBride

customer_reviews.title: Low and slow works best...
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well. It worked better when I set the DA polisher to a lower speed. Worked small sections with 4 or 5 passes in varying directions. It really helps to watch some of the professional videos on YouTube before doing paint correction. See my pic. Thought this worked well on a 2009 Lexus IS250 that did have a good amount of swirl marks and scratches.
customer_reviews.author: 5 DogHouse

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: Tested this product on my hood with the TorQ FX10 DA polisher. The product didn’t do a single thing to the paint. Did not take the swirl marks or the scratches out. My process was -wash -clay bar -VSS
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely am impressed by a product. I’ve been trying to get the streak marks and stains out of my wife’s white van with every product I could find and within two minutes this had it out. Could not believe it. Worked well on my black truck that had severe swirls from previous owner as well. 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Saved me thousands of dollars!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works fantastic. I bought an older 2008 Audi S5 from up north I thought I would need to have it repainted:-/ looked like he washed it with a Brillo pad! I tried this as a last ditch effort before heading to a body shop...Go to their website and follow the instructions. I’ll include before and after photos. It literally saved me 3k and a paint job! No I don’t work for them either but also try their leather sent air freshener smells like real leather for REAL!
customer_reviews.author: Chris link

customer_reviews.title: Good for very light polishing, but that's about it
customer_reviews.text: This is very light-duty polish, it'll get light oxidation, and very light scratches out, but beyond that you're going to want something more aggressive. Meg's M205 is probably a better all-around and more useful product as it does everything CG Scratch and Swirl does, plus it's more effective with light-medium scratches. Not a bad product, it's just pretty limited in scope.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest E Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Better results with far less work
customer_reviews.text: The mad scientists at Chemical Guys did it again.... created a genius of a product that advances polishing 100%. No need to use multiple grades of polish and go over the same ground forever. This stuff is a one step cure for all your paint defects. Hats off th better living through chemistry. Every product I have used from this firm has been. Winner
customer_reviews.author: vector59

customer_reviews.title: shiny
customer_reviews.text: I hand applied with the orange pad. Result wasn't stunning as I expected. I have no knowledge in car detailing so it was my first time trying. I watched a lot of youtube video prior to purchase. most OPs use machine to apply the compound. I may get a DA next time when I decide to redo my car. hopefully result will be better.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for removing water spots!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this polish with a Griots DA polisher to remove some water spots. I tried a number of methods from clay bar, vinegar, meguers compound as well as acid wheel cleaner diluted and nothing could remove the water spots from the clear coat. The spots where only on the hood of my wife's blue 2019 Niisan Rogue. This VSS polish removed the water spots with minimal effort. Just put a wax on after and looks as good as new. Highly recommend this product. I did not receive this at a discount or part of a promotion.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a 3M guy my whole life. No more! This cut the work time in a third and produced superior results! I highly recommend and will never go back to a step product.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not for  scratches
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to use at the shop but it's not that good. It is cheap compare to competitors. Works good for waterspots but you won't be able to remove any scratches at all. Doesn't matter what pad you use. So if your car has no scratches and is brand new then buy this. If you are trying to detail an old car as professional then avoid it.
customer_reviews.author: Shaft

customer_reviews.title: Not great. Try another product.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff goes on nice and cleans off well but it is not a good swirl remover. It does a decent job doing average cleaning but I had to put a lot of pressure on my dual action polisher to get any type of results. This product was a miss for me and I won’t be purchasing it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well.
customer_reviews.text: This really helped my hood roof on my truck. Sitting in the California sun it's whole life wasn't helping my paint out (it's an 03) but this took the oxidized layer on my hood and roof also helped with some of the small scratches I've gotten over the years. It even cleared up my headlights. Over all very happy
customer_reviews.author: Casey H

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected!
customer_reviews.text: I would call myself an Experienced detailer. Before I would use 3 stages of compound and polish. This did it all in one and was super easy to wipe off. I used a DA buffer and chemical guys orange pad. Removed tons of scratches and all water spots.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, it does nothing at all.
customer_reviews.text: I tested this in a small area with a few swirls and chips but it made more. Be very careful if you’re using this and test it on your paint. It did nothing but make more swirls on our 2017 CRV.
customer_reviews.author: BuyerOfThings

customer_reviews.title: Just more swirls.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I used it for one spot and threw it in the garbage. All the good reviews are from those that don’t use lights when polishing. Those that do, you know this is pure marketing scam. To be fair, just stick with their 32~38 polishing package.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: If you go by the instructions this stuff works great, used it on my 1975 Lincoln Continental which has the original paint on it, and took all the swirls and minor scratches out of it making it look like a new paint job, good stuff. Always wax after using a polish.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Saw the reviews for Chemical Guys COM_129_16 Scratch and Swirl Remover (16 oz) and was excited to get swirls and minor scratches out of my truck. Unfortunately after spending 2-1/2 hours of using the remover with a rotary buffing machine and with Chemical Guys buffing pad it was a waste of time and money. The scratches I had on my truck were not through the clear coat. Extremely Disappointing product. False advertisement. DO NOT PURCHASE WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.author: Burton minor

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The surface scratches disappeared completely. I had a couple of deeper scratches caused by an automatic car wash which I knew would be trouble. The product did improve them by 75% which I thought was a good improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Christine D. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but not bad
customer_reviews.text: This compound will not 100% get rid of the surface swirls / scratches. I would suggest going with another company. I tested this on my Honda Civic - which I clay barred prior to the application of this product with a Torq DA polisher. Yes, it got some of the swirls out, but not 100% of it. I would say it's maybe 50-60% effective at combating the swirl/scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: Life saver.
customer_reviews.text: So glad I found this product. I got a small scratch in my door and went overboard with the rubbing compound. I tried waxing and buffing without any improvement. I went out on a limb to try this product and I'm so glad I did. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: J_B_Cran

customer_reviews.title: Great for very minor scratches and swirls.
customer_reviews.text: I had higher hopes for this stuff, it's juat doesn't get as deep as I had hoped. Works well on black and not abrasive enough to cause damage with when used properly. Good intro to polishing but unless the scratches and swirls are very light, you'll want to start with something more than this. This does well at getting rid of the fine scratches from a dirty wash mit.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders. wish it took out deeper scratches but ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonders. wish it took out deeper scratches but for a 1 stage polish/compound worked very well to take out 2500 gritt scratches. the left was polished with the SS and the right was not touched
customer_reviews.author: Shawn A.

customer_reviews.title: I love Chemical Guys products
customer_reviews.text: I love Chemical Guys products, this stuff really brings back paint from bad shape to looking like new! I have been purchasing all of my car cleaning and detailing supplies from Chemical Guys and am very happy with their products!
customer_reviews.author: Passion for Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn't work as described. Total junk as far as i'm concerned. Useless product !!! Would never buy again...
customer_reviews.author: lacewood

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Have not tried It on swirls yet, As far as scratches it did not work as advertised, there are better products out there for less money, that work better.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong I love Chemical Guys products and use quite a few in my arsenal however was disappointed in this product. It didn't do much to remove deeper scratches as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Neo2070

customer_reviews.title: Causes more scratches
customer_reviews.text: This product puts more fine scratches in the clear coat. It slightly fades an existing scratch but it causes more problems. I had to use another product (3m perfect it) to get all the scratches out. I threw the product away as it does nothing to help. 3m perfect it is expensive but it works.
customer_reviews.author: J Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Lousy product. If this is typical of Chemical Guys. Will never buy anything else in the line. Stick with Adams.
customer_reviews.author: mark francis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff WORKS! Highly recommended Used with Griot 6” orbital and orange cutting pads on our black Mercedes Followed up with butter wax. The Correction cream makes all the difference!!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Varn Harper

customer_reviews.title: Restored Paint Beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I love all of the Chemical Guys products that I have purchased. This is no exception at all. I applied using a TORQ polisher on my 2007 Ram and it made the paint look brand new (keep in mind I've waxed and clay-barred, but never polished/buffed). This stuff is pretty awesome and smells great.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Holy Amazing Batman!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in. I thought I'd try it on my old truck that I keep outside under a tree before I used it on my new car. Holy amazing Batman! This stuff rocks! My old truck's paint looks great (and I just applied it by hand). Just go ahead and add to cart right now and stop looking around!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really remove much. Megauirs cheap wax cleaner is much better .
customer_reviews.author: Brandon E.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to clean my paint and prepare it for ceramic coating. I am very happy with product. I have used it by and and with my electric polisher.
customer_reviews.author: KRISTY FOX

customer_reviews.title: Caused its own damage
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this product is a no for me. I believe it is far too abrasive as it has caused far worse scratching and haze than the area I was attempting to correct. Will work to correct the issues this product left behind with meguiars ultimate compound which is one of my usual go to products for minor correction.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan J Davis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than expected even! This stuff was excellent, I used a dual action polisher and did my entire crew cab super duty and still had over half a bottle to spare. It got rid of a majority of swirls and scratches in the paint and removed all the oxidation on the hood and roof like it was nothing. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Just used the product on two different cars in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Just used the product on two different cars in the past month and it's definitely quicker than using a compound and then another product but I'm not sure I see a huge difference in the final results.
customer_reviews.author: Baummer

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to clean my new car and to prep for ceramic coating. Although it’s new from dealer this removed a lot of grime, rail dust and environmental contamination
customer_reviews.author: LUCKY SARAI

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It works! Had some pretty good size scratches on my bumper and used this stuff along with some drill powered sponges and they all buffed right out!
customer_reviews.author: Phil. L

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my 2011 jeep compass
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great. I mean great. If you do the steps right. You can get all of the stuff off your paint. If you do it right and take your time. If you don't take your time, it will not work right for you. Very happy with this VSS. Will buy again when needed......
customer_reviews.author: william j mccabe

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely blown away. I have a black Tahoe and winter is pretty brutal on it between the weather and cinder used on roads. Used this with a Light cut polishing pad. All the scratches and swirls are gone. Paint is beautiful like brand new again. Paired with the Butter Wet Wax. Best results I've ever had. Thanks Chemical Guys for a truely superior product under $20.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a LONG WAY
customer_reviews.text: I used a basic ten inch machine buffer put a new bonnet. It got ALL of the hard water stains out of the paint AND the deep deep water spots. Like an actual year of water spots. All came out of the paint. Unreal. Really happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R Cortes

customer_reviews.title: CRAP PRODUCT!! BUYER BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what the instructions and videos said, let’s just say my husband FLIPPED HIS LID WHEN IT SCREWED UP THE PAINT ON OUR ZO6 CORVETTE!! All of this before our Corvette Show!! We were PISSED!! Stick with the products you know work!! Meguiars!!
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: minor swirls still takes a bit of work to remove
customer_reviews.text: I used an orange pad, but it takes a long time to remove small/light swirls. Better off with Meguiars as those cut through the small stuff substantially quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Bandith P.

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. I had some bird poo etched in my paint and it completely removed it!
customer_reviews.author: Cooper Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Scratches have nothing to fear
customer_reviews.text: Smells nice but the price and end result were disappointing. Did not get out even the smallest scratches. Chemical guys products are normally well made and work as advertised but this one kinda fell short.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: seems to do a good job. I am not a professional detailer
customer_reviews.text: seems to do a good job. I am not a professional detailer, but I like the idea of not having to do too many steps.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Get a sample size b4 u decide to get the bigger bottle
customer_reviews.text: I would take a picture of the damage it has caused but can't really blame the product. Might be great for hand buffing but not buffing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chang

customer_reviews.title: Worked really really good!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very very good!!!somebody scratched my wife's car lightly while pulling out of parking spot...the scratches were very visible,but not deep...this product took the scratches out in 99%...they are barely visible!!I didn't think it will work that good!!
customer_reviews.author: Miko Cz

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't tell if it worked on my silver paint
customer_reviews.text: My car is silver so it was a bit hard to tell if it removed the swirls or not. I'm hoping it did before I applied the ceramic coating
customer_reviews.author: Stevie D.

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Great polishing compound with no wax or polish. Used it for final rubout before ceramic coating. Car now looks showroom sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Life back in to your paint
customer_reviews.text: Takes out 98% of swirls and Haze from clearcoat. Go to YouTube watch two videos don’t be scared. Save me from a paint job.
customer_reviews.author: D. Boisvert

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: After buffing with the VSS, all the swirls that where there are still there. Mabye my paint needs something stronger......??? Made it look good from a distance tho. Smells good too.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Kubond

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. I’m not a professional but I was able to remove the swirl marks from my car. Now I need to try it on a black suburban.
customer_reviews.author: Dario

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Tried this product out to clean up some paint swirls in the car I recently picked up . Very pleased with this product cut through the swirls fast and left a great gloss finish behind
customer_reviews.author: Mandy D

customer_reviews.title: BEST SCRATCH AND SWIRL REMOVER OUT THERE
customer_reviews.text: I use this for when scratches and swirls RANDOMLY appear on my car and it GETS THE JOB DONE RIGHT! This is not some cheap polish that doesn't work. This is a GREAT polish that removes scratches and swirls within seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Luke R.

customer_reviews.title: Swirl Remover Performance
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this on one fender but it is very easy to use & removes all of the swirl marks from using the rubbing compound.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I applied the product by hand with light pressure and follow all instructions. The car now has LOTs of holograms that take away from the shine. I had some guys from a local detailing business and they indicated the product felt rough. I sent a message via facebook page, no response. I would not recommen the product, specially if you have a black car.
customer_reviews.author: Henry O. Ventura

customer_reviews.title: I had my doubts
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts with these products. I have purchased Mother's etc..so I went to a concert came back somebody leaned on my car with those button back pockets. First I cleaned area then used this product with my doubts. The scratches came out I couldn't believe it.. excellent product..
customer_reviews.author: Tom Haller

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Wow... 2001 expedition as far I know has never seen anything close to a wax... And now it looks like new $ Ordering the wax next!
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Good one-step product
customer_reviews.text: Pleasant odor. Goes on smoothly and breaks down with very little dust/residue. Does a good job on light swirls and leaves a nice polish. I like it for a one-step product. It is very difficult to squeeze the product out of the container. That's really the only drawback.
customer_reviews.author: PAB Orlando

customer_reviews.title: WACK!
customer_reviews.text: I like most chemical guys products but this is ain’t it chief. Just do a two step compound/polish instead of this.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Applying by hand is just too tedious and doesn't cut deep enough
customer_reviews.text: I applied by hand and my truck looks awful; you can see every swipe I made. To me, this product should only be applied with a machine. Applying by hand is just too tedious and doesn't cut deep enough. I'm going to do it the right way and use a machine like I should have done in the first place. The other Chemical Guys products I used worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Dax Little

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many products from Chemical Guys and this is the first one that did not do what i expected. Every product i have ever tried before this was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: M Harrelson

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Same as any compund.....Proxy is cheaper and works better for scratches removal.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: Compound is still the way to go although this is great to add on top
customer_reviews.text: I've tried with this alone. Also with compound then this to remove some minor swirl marks. Compound is still the way to go although this is great to add on top.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product a few weeks ago. Today (12.30.16) was the first chance I've had to use it. Wow, it did exactly what I had intended. Removal of swirl marks and cobwebbing. Used it on a black camry. No product is percect which is why I gave it 4 stars. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: jack reed

customer_reviews.title: Works great to remove marks from off-roading due to sticks and brush
customer_reviews.text: Works great for getting pin stripes off from off-roading. I buffed them out by hand and it worked great. For swirl marks you would want to use a polishing machine
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra

customer_reviews.title: Works fabulously!
customer_reviews.text: Completely saved my butt when I rubbed my front bumper on a painted metal pole. This stuff pulled Off the scrape with minimal effort. Worth every dime!
customer_reviews.author: JRWASU

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Did not remove scratches nor swirls! Had to correct using another product, also they don't answer questions poor service.
customer_reviews.author: Revshifu

product_meta.title: Chemical Guys COM_129_16 Scratch and Swirl Remover (16 oz)
product_meta.description: Size:16 OunceScratch and Swirl remover is not a cover up product, a glaze, a wax or a quick solution. It is the 100 percent body shop safe scratch and swirl remover that does just that remove. Scratch & swirl remover is the one step solution for a variety of paint problems. ACU bead this superior diminishing body shop safe product works like a compound then becomes a polish. Will remove many moderate to heavy surface imperfections and 1500 1700 grit sand scratches, swirls, scuff marks spider webbing and most surface imperfection.
feature_bullets: This can remove many moderate to heavy surface imperfections.Works on all colors
Works like a compound, a polish and a cleaner
